title: Half of pension advice firms probed by City watchdog: were you wrongly told to ditch your 'final salary' scheme?
text:
More than 1,600 financial advice firms have been contacted by City regulators who are concerned they may have wrongly told savers to ditch their valuable "final salary" schemes.

Debbie Gupta, a senior figure at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), told a pension conference last week that the watchdog had sent letters to between 1,600 and 1,700 firms as part of its work on transfers out of final salary or "defined benefit" funds.

The FCA warned this summer that it felt some savers were being wrongly advised and that transferring out of generous, inflation-linked schemes would not make sense for most people.

A pension set to pay £30,000 a year might be traded in for as much as £1m in cash.
